text: Josh Harvey-Clemons (born February 20, 1994) is an American football linebacker for the Washington Football Team of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football at Louisville and was drafted by Washington, then known as the Redskins, in the seventh round of the 2017 NFL Draft. Harvey-Clemons originally played at Georgia before transferring to Louisville. ==Professional career== Harvey-Clemons was drafted by the Washington Redskins in the seventh round, 230th overall, in the 2017 NFL Draft. In his rookie year, he played 10 games primarily as a backup at inside linebacker; recording 10 tackles, half of a sack, and one pass deflection. He opted out of the 2020 season due to concerns about the COVID-19 pandemic as he and his two sons have asthma. ==References== ==External links== * Louisville Cardinals bio *Washington Football Team bio Category:1994 births Category:Living people Category:Players of American football from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:People from Valdosta, Georgia Category:American football safeties Category:American football linebackers Category:Louisville Cardinals football players Category:Georgia Bulldogs football players Category:Washington Redskins players Category:Washington Football Team players
title: Josh Harvey-Clemons
